meanings.def: to give somebody/something a higher position or rank, often more important than they deserve
examples: elevate somebody/something (to something) He elevated many of his friends to powerful positions within the government.
elevate something (into/to something) It was an attempt to elevate football to a subject worthy of serious study.
He has elevated bad taste into an art form.

meanings.def: to lift something up or put something in a higher position
examples: It is important that the injured leg should be elevated.

meanings.def: to make the level of something increase
to improve a person’s mood, so that they feel happy
examples: The song never failed to elevate his spirits.
